metadata.dc:author: Suárez Pinilla, M A
Gota Angel, R
Millastre Benito, A
Ostabal Artigas, M I
metadata.dc:description: In the last five year, 198 critic patients developed acute renal failure, requiring hemodialysis in the hospital. We realized a descriptive study and analyzed the factors that were statistically associated with higher mortality: a surgical etiology, clinic criteria for the inicial of hemodialysis, respiratory failure, hemodynamic inestability, hepatic insufficciency, disseminated intravascular coagulacion and oliguric or anuria. The sepsis and the cardiorrespiratory complications were the cause of mortality most important. The 14% of the surviving requiring continue in the programs of hemodyalisis.
metadata.dc:title: Estudio descriptivo de la hemodiálisis en el paciente crítico. A propósito de 198 casos.
[Descriptive study of hemodialysis in the critical patient. Report of 198 cases].
